comments: It is known that a(n) > 0 for all n (Tchebycheff, 1850).The analog for Ramanujan primes is Paksoy's theorem that 2*R(n) - R(n+1) > 0 for n > 1. See A233822. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Dec 16 2013
references: J. V. Uspensky and M. A. Heaslet, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, NY, 1939.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062234.txt", n, " ", 2*prime(n) - prime(n + 1)) ) } # _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 03 2009(Haskell)a062234 n = a062234_list !! (n-1)a062234_list = zipWith (-) (map (* 2) a000040_list) (tail a000040_list)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 31 2015
author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 29 2001
